top.title: Trump says he will '100%' carry out Greenland tariffs threat, as EU vows to protect its interests
top.summary: Kaja Kallas, the EU's foreign policy chief, said the bloc has "no interest to pick a fight, but we will hold our ground".

top.title: Confronted over Greenland, Europe is ditching its softly-softly approach to Trump
top.summary: Transatlantic relations aren't broken, though they are damaged. And if Europeans want to try to cut through with Trump, they'll have to stick together, writes Europe Editor Katya Adler

top.title: Spain to hold three days of mourning for victims of high-speed train crash
top.summary: At least 40 people died in Sunday's collision in  southern Spain, the worst crash the country has seen in more than a decade.

top.title: UK to consult on social media ban for under 16s
top.summary: The government said it expected schools to be "phone-free by default" as a result of the announcement.

top.title: How crypto criminals stole $700 million from people - often using age-old tricks
top.summary: As crypto wealth continues to grow, criminals are mixing sophisticated hacks with deception, and in some cases, real life violence.

top.title: Google appeals landmark antitrust verdict over search monopoly
top.summary: The tech giant is seeking a pause on court-ordered fixes aimed at limiting its monopoly power.

title.#text: How much can a city take?
A second US Sphere could come to Maryland
